doc.abstracts: The Central African Republic loses 13.2 billion FCFA annually because of poor sanitation, which is equivalent to 26 million USD, according to a review conducted by the Water and Sanitation Program (WSP). This amount is equivalent to 5.5 USD per capita a year in the Central African Republic, or 1.2percent of GDP. 2.2 million Central Africans use unsanitary latrines or shared latrines. Almost 1 million have no latrines at all and defecate outdoors. The poorest quintile is more than 100 times more likely to practice open defecation than the two least richt quintiles. The open defecation costs the Central African Republic $ 9.1 million per year – yet elimination of this practice would require the construction and use of less than 200,000 latrines.
